title: URL Parser
description: Parse URLs (Uniform Resource Locators) into structured components including scheme, host, port, path, query parameters, and fragment.

motivation.why: URLs are fundamental to web development, API design, and routing systems. Parsing URLs correctly is essential for web servers, clients, routers, and security validation.

inputFormat.description: URLs follow a standard format: scheme://host[:port][/path][?query][#fragment]. The scheme is required, as is the host. Port, path, query, and fragment are optional.

examples.description: Complex URL with query and fragment

outputFormat.description: The parser returns a ParsedUrl struct with each URL component as a separate field, with proper types for optional components.

scheme.description: String - the protocol (http, https, ftp, etc.)

host.description: String - the domain or IP address
